byline.contributor: Susanne Craig reported from Cadyville, and William K. Rashbaum from New York. Benjamin Mueller and Michael Winerip contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

abstract: Corrections Officer Gene Palmer becomes second employee at Clinton Correctional Facility to be charged in connection with escape of Richard W Matt and David P Sweat; Palmer denies accusation that he helped Joyce E Mitchell smuggle hacksaw blades to men.
lead_paragraph: Gene Palmer, a corrections officer recently placed on administrative leave after the prison escape, has been arrested and charged with promoting prison contraband, the State Police said.

headline.main: 2nd Prison Worker Is Charged as Search for Escaped Killers in New York Continues
headline.print_headline: A Second Prison Worker Is Charged as the Search for 2 Escapees Continues

snippet: Gene Palmer, a corrections officer recently placed on administrative leave after the prison escape, has been arrested and charged with promoting prison contraband, the State Police said.
